item.title: Lovely Eye
item.description:
Lovely Eye

Lovely Eye is self-hosted, cookie-less, lighweight analytics written in GO programming language with the React/Typescript dashboard. Evolving to be optimized alternative for Umami and Plausible.
Alternative to Medama.
item.content:encoded:
Lovely Eye

Lovely Eye is self-hosted, cookie-less, lighweight analytics written in GO programming language with the React/Typescript dashboard. Evolving to be optimized alternative for Umami and Plausible.
Alternative to Medama.

item.title: Last Signal
item.description:
Last Signal

item.title: Spreadsheet
item.description:
Spreadsheet

A lightweight, client-only spreadsheet web application. All data persists in the URL hash for instant sharing, No backend required. Optional AES-GCM password protection keeps shared links locked without a server
item.content:encoded:
Spreadsheet

A lightweight, client-only spreadsheet web application. All data persists in the URL hash for instant sharing, No backend required. Optional AES-GCM password protection keeps shared links locked without a server

item.title: Expense Management Software & Reporting Solution
item.description:
Expense Management Software & Reporting Solution

Automate your expenses with Ramp. Simplify tracking, reimbursement, and reporting with our intuitive expense management platform.
I read on r/Accounting that this can easily integrate with Quickbooks online (QBO). Let’s see.
item.content:encoded:
Expense Management Software & Reporting Solution

Automate your expenses with Ramp. Simplify tracking, reimbursement, and reporting with our intuitive expense management platform.
I read on r/Accounting that this can easily integrate with Quickbooks online (QBO). Let’s see.

item.title: Grist: More Action Button Widget Explanation
item.description:
Grist: More Action Button Widget Explanation

Grist has an extremely useful feature: User Actions. Unfortunately, there is almost no documentation on this subject. This post is my attempt to solve this problem, and empower more people (both user and developers) to use them.
item.content:encoded:
Grist: More Action Button Widget Explanation

Grist has an extremely useful feature: User Actions. Unfortunately, there is almost no documentation on this subject. This post is my attempt to solve this problem, and empower more people (both user and developers) to use them.

item.title: lookupOrAddDerived Undocumented Grist Function
item.description:
lookupOrAddDerived Undocumented Grist Function

There is an undocumented method lookupOrAddDerived, which behaves like lookupOne but creates a matching record if one isnâ€™t found.
We need to explore this function. This cound be useful for several of our use cases.
item.content:encoded:
lookupOrAddDerived Undocumented Grist Function

There is an undocumented method lookupOrAddDerived, which behaves like lookupOne but creates a matching record if one isnâ€™t found.
We need to explore this function. This cound be useful for several of our use cases.
